description: This holiday season, every time you buy one of our Lucky's Market products, 10% of the profits go to Community Action Network (CAN) of Ann Arbor to provide food for families who need some extra help. Look for the red L throughout the store to get products that are a great value, taste great, have no artifical colors, preservatives, or flavors, and give back to the community at the same time. This program runs from November 9th through December 14th, so mark your calendars and thank you for helping us make Ann Arbor a great place for everyone!
name: 10% For Good for Community Action Network

description:
Our featured author is Cole Lavalais whose short stories can be found in Obsidian, Apogee, Warpland, Tidal Basin Review, Aquarius Press, and more. She is a fellow of the Kimbilio Center for Black Fiction, VONA and the Callaloo Writing Workshops. She's been awarded writing residencies at the Vermont Studio Center and The Noepe Center for the Literary Arts. She holds an M.F.A. from Chicago State University, and a Ph.D. in Creative Writing from University of Illinois at Chicago. 

As a born and raised Chicagoan, she believes in encouraging, fostering, and championing writing by writers of color across genres. Cole has taught writing for over ten years and currently teaches community-based writing workshops on the south side of Chicago. Summer of the Cicadas is her debut novel.

The event begins with an Open Mic session when area poets can read their own work or share a favorite poem by another author in a welcoming atmosphere. This event is part of a series held on the second Thursday of most months at 7pm in partnership with  Les Go Social Media Marketing and Training.
name: Open Mic & Share Series feat Cole Lavalais

description:
$5 / Under 21 $8 - 18+ - Doors 9:30 p.m. 

- GRIFFIN SCHULTZ - 
Technometalloid sunshine. Electronic acoustic melodies with sweet guitar espresso. Local music boy. 
 (❀˙˘˙)♡(˙˘˙❀)
soundcloud.com/worksboom

- THE 4TH WALL - 
Some guy playing guitar and singing along to some homemade funky electronic beats.
-- Link:  soundcloud.com/natezuellig

- DAVE MENZO -
Known for his 'one man band on steroids' show, Dave has an elaborate looping setup that allows him to create dynamic tracks on the spot. His loops are controlled live, and operate as his backing band while he shreds and sings.
-- Link: soundcloud.com/davemenzo

- PAJAMAS -
Ann Arbor based jam trio with an emphasis on high energy improvisation and booty movement. The trio is complete with intricate drumming, soaring lead guitar, and melodic, slap laden bass. Each performance is a musical experiment attempting to redefine performance as a righteous, never ending journey and not simply a list of songs back to back.
-- Link: Facebook.com/pajamasband


'Twil be a night of electro-acoustic fusion, funk, and vibratory liberation. Come and get down.
name: Dave Menzo / Pajamas / Griffin Schultz / the 4th Wall - LIVE 2/9

description: This class will introduce you to the Amaya Bravo 16-Thread CNC Embroidery Machine and the Design Shop software that lets you create digitalized embroidery files from an image file. This machine is great for monogramming shirts or towels, decorating bags and accessories and making patches! Use the Design Shop software and design your own. There is also a baseball cap attachment! You will learn the basic operation with an emphasis on safety. With the successful completion of this class you will be certified to use the Amaya CNC Embroidery Machine on your own.
name: Learn to use the Amaya CNC Embroidery Machine

description:
Joins us for our special Valentine's Day creations all weekend long all they way through Valentine's Day. 

We'll be featuring some great Food & Beverage Specials. To make your reservations visit SavasRestaurant.com/reservations or call us at 734-623-2233

DRINK SPECIALS
__________________

A FRENCH ROSE
creme yvette, cocchi americano rosa, parigot rosé

QUEEN OF HEARTS
hendrick's gin, st. germain, lavender syrup, lemon juice, cranberry juice, apple-cranberry cider

KING OF HEARTS
johnnie walker red, averna, carpano antica, chocolate bitters

DINNER SPECIALS
__________________

FILET & PRAWNS
choice grade 6 oz. filet with 2 jumbo prawns and beurre maître d’hotel. With pommes fondant and veal glazed carrots

MOULES  CHAMPAGNE 
bay harbor mussels steamed in an herbed champagne cream broth, served with baguette

OYSTERS
oysters, black pepper-balsamic sorbet, minced shallot, micro radish, cucumber brunoise

HALF-ROAST CHICKEN
brined half-chicken, roasted fingerling potatoes, warm spinach salad with apple, sarvecchio and creamy bacon vinaigrette

RISOTTO STUFFED SQUASH
butternut squash risotto, wild mushroom blend, braised leeks, roast acorn squash, curried romesco, roasted asparagus
name: Sava's Valentine's Day Featured Food & Beverage Specials

name: Lucky's Market Tasting

description:
Don't miss Artini 2017, which in its 9th edition will once again transform the Downtown Ann Arbor area into a festive competition between the finest bars and restaurants, where the goal is to design the city's most artful martini!

Artini will be on Friday, February 10, from 6:30 to 10:00 pm. Tickets will be for sale on Wednesday, January 4th for members of the Ann Arbor Art Center and on Friday, January 6th for all! As usual tickets will sell fast, so please make sure you purchase yours as soon as possible (in 2016 we sold out in 10 days!) to guarantee your spot.

WHAT IS ARTINI?

Artini is an annual fundraiser hosted by the Ann Arbor Art Center in which local bars and restaurants are invited to compete to create the most artful and innovative martini cocktail. Guests purchase tickets to participate in a fun bar crawl amongst the participating venues and spend the evening walking in Downtown Ann Arbor for the search of the best tasting martini.

Participating Venues (with new ones added daily!)
Alley Bar
Aventura Ann Arbor
Babs' Underground
The Beer Grotto Ann Arbor
Black Pearl
Conor O'Neills Ann Arbor
Felix Bistro & Bar
Isalita
Mélange
The Pretzel Bell
The Ravens Club

*Attendees must be 21 or older by 2/10/2017. Ticket prices are $55 and are non-refundable. The Ann Arbor Art Center is a 501©(3) and $25 of your Artini ticket is tax deductible.

#A2ARTINI

--------------

Artini 2017 is sponsored by Alex Milshteyn Real Estate Associates 

Beverage sponsor Two James Spirits
name: Artini 2017
